Class Position

java.lang.Object
train.Position
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
public class Position extends Object implements Cloneable
Représentation de la position d'un train dans le circuit. Une position est caractérisée par deux valeurs :
  1. L'élément où se positionne le train : une gare (classe Station) ou une section de voie ferrée (classe Section).
  2. La direction qu'il prend (enumération Direction) : de gauche à droite ou de droite à gauche.
Version:
0.3 Authors of the new implementation
Author:
Fabien Dagnat invalid input: '<'fabien.dagnat@imt-atlantique.fr> Modifié par Mayte Segarra, Philippe Tanguy invalid input: '<'philippe.tanguy@imt-atlantique.fr>, Othmane EL AKRABA invalid input: '<'othmane.el-akraba@imt-atlantique.net>, Soufiane LACHGUER invalid input: '<'soufiane.lachguer@imt-atlantique.net>

  • Constructor Details

    • Position

      public Position(Element elt, Direction d)
      Constructor that initializes a position with a direction and an element If either are null, then a NullPointerException is thrown
      Parameters:
      elt - Element occupied by a train
      d - direction of the train
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if either entries are null

  • Method Details

    • clone

      public Position clone()
      Method that clones the position so that it can be assigned to a train. If the position can't be cloned, it returns a null position.
      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
      Returns:
      A position to be assigned to a train.

    • getPos

      public Element getPos()
      Returns the element where the train is positioned
      Returns:
      Element where the train is positioned

    • getDirection

      public Direction getDirection()
      Returns the direction of the train
      Returns:
      the direction of the train

    • updatePosition

      public void updatePosition(Element p)
      Method that updates the position of a train (quits the old position and enters the next one). If the train enters a section of the railway, it conserves its direction.
      Parameters:
      p - The element that the train will enter

    • updateDirection

      public void updateDirection(Direction d)
      Method that updates the train's direction and notifies all trains on the same railway
      Parameters:
      d - New updated direction

    • turnAround

      public void turnAround()
      Method that makes a train turn around. Firstly, it looks up the direction used by the railway, and calls the updateDirection() method to change the train's direction as well as the switchDirection() method to change the railway's direction

    • occupy

      public void occupy()
      Method that sets the element occupied to be occupied

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string containing information about the train's position
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      String containing information about the train's position (element occupied and direction)
